update.description:
Breaking pose commands from @iche033 's pull request #316 into another PR for quicker review.

Addressed remaining feedback and also added example instructions and a test.
update.title: [Blueprint] Pose commands

content.raw: Yes, I think we can merge this PR.
content.html: Yes, I think we can merge this PR.

content.raw: Can someone with more in-depth knowledge than myself create the issue in the appropriate location?
content.html: Can someone with more in-depth knowledge than myself create the issue in the appropriate location?

content.raw: Is it okay to create an issue for this, and save the fix for post blueprint release?
content.html: Is it okay to create an issue for this, and save the fix for post blueprint release?

content.raw: Yeah I was wondering about where the problem was. But I came to the conclusion that `FindFreeGroup` would return the group within the model, without taking its canonical offset into account. So I added the offset here.
content.html: Yeah I was wondering about where the problem was. But I came to the conclusion that FindFreeGroup would return the group within the model, without taking its canonical offset into account. So I added the offset here.

content.raw: This looks like a bug in ign-physics. The code [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/src/default/dartsim/src/FreeGroupFeatures.cc#lines-120) should take into account the offset of the model frame from the canonical link. I'll create an issue.
content.html: This looks like a bug in ign-physics. The code here should take into account the offset of the model frame from the canonical link. I'll create an issue.

content.raw: This is great! Thanks for taking care of this!
content.html: This is great! Thanks for taking care of this!

content.raw: I believe b379bac fixes this. The issue was that I was removing the `WorldPoseCmd` component from entities inside an `Each` call.
content.html: I believe b379bac fixes this. The issue was that I was removing the WorldPoseCmd component from entities inside an Each call.

update.description:
Breaking pose commands from @iche033 's pull request #316 into another PR for quicker review.

Addressed remaining feedback and also added example instructions and a test.
update.title: [Blueprint] Pose commands

content.raw:
dbfa1f4 fixed the issue with the canonical link pose described by @nkoenig [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/316/blueprint-add-support-for-moving-and/diff#comment-102039932).

Try `debug_shapes.sdf` using this command:

`ign service -s /world/shapes/set_pose --reqtype ignition.msgs.Pose --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 300 --req 'name: "box_link_transform", position: {z: 2.0}'`

Without the fix, even though we're setting the same model pose as in the SDF file, the model jumps. With the fix, the model stays in place.
content.html:
dbfa1f4 fixed the issue with the canonical link pose described by @nkoenig here.

Try debug_shapes.sdf using this command:

ign service -s /world/shapes/set_pose --reqtype ignition.msgs.Pose --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 300 --req 'name: "box_link_transform", position: {z: 2.0}'

Without the fix, even though we're setting the same model pose as in the SDF file, the model jumps. With the fix, the model stays in place.

I have no idea what's going on. Since ign-gazebo is not fully working on Mac, we could let this one slide for now if we're in a hurry.

update.description:

Addressed remaining feedback and also added example instructions and a test.
update.title: [Blueprint] Pose commands

content.raw: LGTM. Left minor comments. Waiting on green CI.
content.html: LGTM. Left minor comments. Waiting on green CI.

content.raw: Technically, if the system actually moved the link and this is a canonical link, it will also move the parent model so the value of `component::Pose` (the pose of the link relative to its parent model) won't change. I think it might be a good idea to also check here that the parent model did not move.
content.html: Technically, if the system actually moved the link and this is a canonical link, it will also move the parent model so the value of component::Pose (the pose of the link relative to its parent model) won't change. I think it might be a good idea to also check here that the parent model did not move.
